title: Numerics
text: Numeric row rounded second decimal place: Entry-specific rounding:
code: vec <- c(1.0, 1.01, 1.001) TexRow(vec, dec = 2) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> 1.00 & 1.01 & 1.00 \\ #> \end{tabular} vec <- c(1.0, 1.01, 1.001) TexRow(vec, dec = c(2,4,6)) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> 1.00 & 1.0100 & 1.001000 \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: Numerics
text: Numeric row numbers percentages: entries percentages:
code: vec <- c(20,30,40) TexRow(vec, dec = 0, percentage = TRUE) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> 20\% & 30\% & 40\% \\ #> \end{tabular} vec <- c(2.4344, 40.12) TexRow(vec, dec = c(2,1), percentage = c(FALSE, TRUE)) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> 2.43 & 40.1\% \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: Numerics
text: Numeric row numbers dollars: entries dollars:
code: vec <- c(20.32,30.67,40.98) TexRow(vec, dec = 2, dollar = TRUE) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> \$20.32 & \$30.67 & \$40.98 \\ #> \end{tabular} vec <- c(2.4344, 40.12) TexRow(vec, dec = c(2,1), percentage = c(FALSE, TRUE), dollar = c(TRUE, FALSE)) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> \$2.43 & 40.1\% \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: Numerics
text: Numeric row numbers standard errors: entries standard errors:
code: vec <- c(20.32,30.67,40.98) TexRow(vec, dec = 2, se = TRUE) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:42 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> (20.32) & (30.67) & (40.98) \\ #> \end{tabular} vec <- c(2.4344, 0.3815) TexRow(vec, dec = 3, se = c(FALSE, TRUE)) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:43 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> 2.434 & (0.382) \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: Numerics
text: Infer p-value numeric vector: p < 0.1 gives 1 star p < 0.05 gives 2 stars p < 0.01 gives 3 stars
code: vec <- c(1,2,3) TexRow(vec, dec = 2, pvalues = c(0.09, 0.04, 0.009)) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:43 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> 1.00* & 2.00** & 3.00*** \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: install package: use package installed:
code: devtools::install_github("setzler/textab") library(textab)

title: textab
text: Basic character row: Character row LaTeX formatting: Note: Double backslashes required LaTeX commands.
code: vec = c("hello", "world") TexRow(vec) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> hello & world \\ #> \end{tabular} vec = c('Hello','\\textbf{World}','$\\alpha$','$\\frac{1}{2}$') TexRow(vec) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrrr} #> Hello & \textbf{World} & $\alpha$ & $\frac{1}{2}$ \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: Basic numeric row: Numeric row rounded second decimal place: four arguments specific numeric rows: percentage: TRUE, add “%” sign number. dollar: TRUE, add “$” sign number. se: TRUE, surround number parentheses. pvalues: provided, numbers used add stars “*” numbers. See article formatting numbers. can also run following command R see available formatting options:
code: vec <- c(1.0, 1.01, 1.001) TexRow(vec) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> 1.0000 & 1.0100 & 1.0010 \\ #> \end{tabular} vec <- c(1.0, 1.01, 1.001) TexRow(vec, dec = 2) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> 1.00 & 1.01 & 1.00 \\ #> \end{tabular} ?TexRow

title: textab
text: many common formatting options explicitly provided TexRow, also include surround argument user can specify custom formatting. surround argument allows provide raw LaTeX code. Place %s symbol wherever number character placed. Suppose wish make number red. LaTeX, can make number red using code {\color{red} %s}, %s indicates number go. order make number red, specify following: Note: Double backslashes required LaTeX commands. surround argument works character vectors well, can apply different formatting value:
code: vec = c(5.081, 2.345, 6.789) TexRow(vec, dec = 1, surround = "{\\color{red} %s}") #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> {\color{red} 5.1} & {\color{red} 2.3} & {\color{red} 6.8} \\ #> \end{tabular} vec = c("hello", "world") TexRow(vec, dec = 1, surround = c("{\\color{blue} %s}", "$\\frac{\\text{%s}}{2}$")) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> {\color{blue} hello} & $\frac{\text{world}}{2}$ \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: Merge center second third rows using cspan argument: Merge right-align second third rows using position argument: Two multi-column rows, first two-column left-aligned second three-column right-aligned:
code: vec = c("hello", "world") TexRow(vec, cspan = c(1,2)) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> hello & \multicolumn{2}{c}{world} \\ #> \end{tabular} vec = c("hello", "world") TexRow(vec, cspan = c(1,2), position = "r") #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> hello & \multicolumn{2}{r}{world} \\ #> \end{tabular} vec = c("hello", "world") TexRow(vec, cspan = c(2,3), position = c("l","r")) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> \multicolumn{2}{l}{hello} & \multicolumn{3}{r}{world} \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: minus sign - combines rows side--side:
code: first_block = TexRow(c("hello", "world")) second_block = TexRow(c("$\\alpha$","$\\frac{1}{2}$")) combined_row = first_block - second_block combined_row #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrrr} #> hello & world & $\alpha$ & $\frac{1}{2}$ \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: plus sign + stacks rows vertically:
code: first_block = TexRow(c("hello", "world")) second_block = TexRow(c("$\\alpha$","$\\frac{1}{2}$")) combined_row = first_block + second_block combined_row #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> hello & world \\ #> $\alpha$ & $\frac{1}{2}$ \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: add 3pt space two rows:
code: TexRow(c("hello", "world"), space=3) +   TexRow(c('$\\alpha$','$\\frac{1}{2}$')) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rr} #> hello & world \\[3pt] #> $\alpha$ & $\frac{1}{2}$ \\ #> \end{tabular}

title: textab
text: Add full midrule two rows: Add two partial midrules: information TexMidrule, run following command:
code: TexRow(c("hello", "world"), cspan=c(1,2)) +    TexMidrule() +   TexRow(c('$\\alpha$','$\\frac{1}{2}$','$\\sqrt{\\frac{2}{3}}$')) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> hello & \multicolumn{2}{c}{world} \\ #> \midrule  #> $\alpha$ & $\frac{1}{2}$ & $\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}}$ \\ #> \end{tabular} TexRow(c("hello", "world"), cspan=c(1,2)) +    TexMidrule(list(c(1,1), c(2,3))) +   TexRow(c('$\\alpha$','$\\frac{1}{2}$','$\\sqrt{\\frac{2}{3}}$')) #> % created using textables on Wed Mar 22 21:19:44 2023 #> \begin{tabular}{rrr} #> hello & \multicolumn{2}{c}{world} \\ #>  \cmidrule(lr){1-1} \cmidrule(lr){2-3}  #> $\alpha$ & $\frac{1}{2}$ & $\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}}$ \\ #> \end{tabular} ?TexMidrule

what: 8. Save a LaTeX table in .tex format
title: textab
text: Let us work following table: Save simple .tex document containing table: Save stand-alone .tex document compiled, begin-document end-document statements well import statements common LaTeX packages: information TexSave, run following command:
code: tt = TexRow(c("hello", "world"), cspan=c(1,2), surround = c("{\\color{red} %s}", "{\\color{blue} %s}")) +    TexMidrule(list(c(1,1), c(2,3))) +   TexRow(c('$\\alpha$','$\\frac{1}{2}$','$\\sqrt{\\frac{2}{3}}$')) TexSave(tab = tt, positions = c("l","c","c"),         filename = "example1", output_path = "~/github/textab/inst/") TexSave(tab = tt, positions = c("l","c","c"),         filename = "example2", output_path = "~/github/textab/inst/",          stand_alone = TRUE) ?TexSave

what: 9. Save LaTeX Table and Compile to PDF
title: textab
text: Produce compile stand-alone .tex document .pdf: final command produced PDF table .
code: TexSave(tab = tt, positions = c("l","c","c"),         filename = "example3", output_path = "~/github/textab/inst/",          stand_alone = TRUE, compile_tex = TRUE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thibaut Lamadon. Author. Bradley Setzler. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lamadon T, Setzler B (2023). textab: Create Highly-Customized LaTeX Tables R. R package version 0.1, https://setzler.github.io/textab/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {textab: Create Highly-Customized LaTeX Tables in R},   author = {Thibaut Lamadon and Bradley Setzler},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1},   url = {https://setzler.github.io/textab/}, }

what: Create Highly-Customized LaTeX Tables in R
title: Create Highly-Customized LaTeX Tables in R
text: Created Thibaut Lamadon Bradley Setzler textab package produces highly-customized LaTeX tables R. three functions package: TexRow: Form row LaTeX tabular environment. TexSave: Save tabular .tex file, optionally compile PDF. TexMidrule: Insert midrule, list partial midrules, rows LaTeX tabular environment. package builds LaTeX tables blocks, spirit ggplot2, using + - operators concatenation. minus sign (-): Combine rows side--side (forming wider row). plus sign (+): Stack rows vertically (multiple rows). install package: use package installed: get started, read following articles: Get Started Function Documentation. Formatting Numbers.
code: devtools::install_github("setzler/textab") library(textab)

what: Create one (or many) partial midrule(s). — TexMidrule
title: Create one (or many) partial midrule(s). — TexMidrule
text: Create one (many) partial midrule(s).

title: Create one (or many) partial midrule(s). — TexMidrule
code: TexMidrule(rule_list = NULL)

title: Create one (or many) partial midrule(s). — TexMidrule
text: rule_list (list). list integer vectors. integer vector must contain two integers indicate start end column partial midrule. rule_list = NULL, returns full midrule across columns. default rule_list = NULL.

what: This function creates a row of a LaTeX table. — TexRow
title: This function creates a row of a LaTeX table. — TexRow
text: function creates row LaTeX table.

title: This function creates a row of a LaTeX table. — TexRow
code: TexRow(   value,   cspan = rep(1, length(value)),   position = rep("c", length(value)),   surround = "%s",   dec = 4,   big.mark = ",",   percentage = FALSE,   dollar = FALSE,   se = FALSE,   pvalues = NULL,   space = 0 )

title: This function creates a row of a LaTeX table. — TexRow
text: value value(s) formatted. Must numeric character vector. cspan (integer). greater 1, multicolumn{cspan}{position}{value} used. example, cspan=c(1,2,1) means second entry value span 2 columns. Default cspan = rep(1, length(value)). position (character). cspan > 1, multicolumn{cspan}{position}{value} used. example, position=c("l","c","r") means second entry value centered. Default position = rep("c", length(value)). surround (character). applied value sprintf(surround, value), surround must contain "%s" placeholder. Default "%s". dec (integer). relevant value numeric. Number decimal places. scalar, decimal used entry value. vector, must length value. big.mark (character). relevant value numeric. Used separator within large numbers. Default "," produces comma (1,201,390). percentage (logical). relevant value numeric. TRUE, percentage symbol "%" added end entry value. scalar, used entries value. vector, must length value. dollar (logical). relevant value numeric. TRUE, dollar sign "$" added end entry value. scalar, used entries value. vector, must length value. se (logical). relevant value numeric. TRUE, value wrapped parentheses. scalar, used entries value. vector, must length value. pvalues (numeric). relevant value numeric. NULL, must numeric. less 0.1, star "" added end entry value. less 0.05, second star "" appended. less 0.01, third star "*" appended. scalar, used entries value. vector, must length value. space (numeric). number points (pt) vertical space append end row. Default 3, creates 3pt vertical space.

what: Compile a tabular object to a pdf file — TexSave
title: Compile a tabular object to a pdf file — TexSave
text: Compile tabular object pdf file

title: Compile a tabular object to a pdf file — TexSave
code: TexSave(   tab,   filename,   positions,   pretty_rules = TRUE,   output_path = getwd(),   stand_alone = FALSE,   compile_tex = FALSE )

title: Compile a tabular object to a pdf file — TexSave
text: tab Object created TexRow() filename (character). file saved filename.tex. positions (character). Vector positions, e.g., "c("l","c","r")" means first column left-aligned, second column center-aligned, third column right-aligned. pretty_rules (logical). TRUE, extra formatting rules added bottom top tabular. output_path (character). directory path file saved. Default current directory. stand_alone (logical). TRUE, tabular exported TeX file can compiled PDF directly (rather included separate TeX file). Default FALSE. compile_tex (logical). TRUE, pdflatex used compile TeX table PDF. allowed stand_alone=TRUE. Default FALSE.

title: Concatenate textab blocks horizontally (side-by-side). — -.tt_
text: Concatenate textab blocks horizontally (side--side).

title: Concatenate textab blocks horizontally (side-by-side). — -.tt_
code: # S3 method for tt_ -(top_row, bottom_row)

title: Concatenate textab blocks horizontally (side-by-side). — -.tt_
text: top_row top tabular row. bottom_row bottom tabular row.

title: Concatenate textab blocks vertically. — +.tt_
text: Concatenate textab blocks vertically.

title: Concatenate textab blocks vertically. — +.tt_
code: # S3 method for tt_ +(left_block, right_block)

title: Concatenate textab blocks vertically. — +.tt_
text: left_block left block tabular row. right_block right block tabular row.

what: Print a textab block as a LaTeX tabular. — print.tt_block
title: Print a textab block as a LaTeX tabular. — print.tt_block
text: Print textab block LaTeX tabular.

title: Print a textab block as a LaTeX tabular. — print.tt_block
code: # S3 method for tt_block print(x, ...)

title: Print a textab block as a LaTeX tabular. — print.tt_block
text: x textab block. ... Placeholder print.
